title_sort: walt whitman to herbert gilchrist, 31 march 1882
title: Walt Whitman to Herbert Gilchrist, 31 March 1882
text: Kirkwood (Glendale)March 31 '82U S ADown here again spending a few days—nothing very different—pretty much the same story of all my letters—but I knew you would like to hear—Mrs S[tafford] and all the family well as usual—they often speak of you & of the old times—I was over to the creek and by the old walnut-trees last week—all beautiful & refreshing as ever—Harry is still at Clementon—Mont is with B. S. at Kirkwood station—Ed has gone up to Phila:Philadelphia to-day for store goods—Do you know of David Bogue, bookseller, Trafalgar Sq:Square who publishes my book in London? Have you ever been in his place? I go up to Camden this evening—Yours of last Jan:January & your mother's of Feb.February 6 rec'dreceived—W W Walt Whitman to Herbert Gilchrist, 31 March 1882
